acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from King William County. Portions of the collection were transferred under the following accession numbers: 20067, 20068, 20069.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: King William County was formed in 1701 from King and Queen County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: King William County (Va.) County Court Records 1701-1884. These records include the following series that are photostat copies: deeds, state appraisals and wills. The office of the clerk of the court of King William County was burned in 1885 and the records almost altogether were destroyed. Charred and fragments of sheets from the various books whose bindings had been burned off were thrown together without regard to date or subject matter and bound into seventeen volumes, These have all been photostated. Before binding the prints however, the effort has been made to arrange them. In order to show where in the seventeen volumes referred to the original for each print is to be found page and volume reference is given on the print.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional King William County Court Records can be found on microfilm at The Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.

King William County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional King William County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
